sen.j: 文武王（ぶんぶおう、生年不詳 - 681年）は、新羅の第30代の王（在位661年 - 681年）であり、姓は金、諱は法敏。
sen.e: King Munmu (year of birth unknown to 681) was the 30th ruler of the Korean kingdom of Silla (reigned from 661 to 681), whose family name was Kim and given name was Beopmin.
King Munmu (year of birth unknown to 681) was the 30th king of the Korean kingdom of Silla (reigned from 661 to 681), whose family name was Kim and given name was Beopmin.
King Munmu (year of birth unknown - 681) was the 30th king of the Korean kingdom of Silla (reigned from 661 to 681), whose family name was Kim and given name was Beopmin.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルにあわせてto→ハイフンにしました。

sen.j: 先代の武烈王の長子であり、母は新羅官位制度（1等官）の金舒玄の娘（金庾信の妹）の文明夫人。
sen.e: He was the eldest child of King Muyeol, the former king, and Munmyeong, a daughter of Kim 舒玄, first-rank officer of the official rank system in Silla (younger sister of Kim Yu-shin).
He was the eldest child of King Muyeol, the former king, and Munmyeong, a daughter of Kim So Hyun, who was a Tsunuka (first-ranked officer), and she was also a younger sister of Kim Yu-shin.
sen.cmt: 「新羅官位制度」はリンク先の用語で原文は「角干」。また金舒玄の読みはキムソヒョンです。
sen.e: He was the eldest child of King Muyeol, the former king, and Munmyeong, a daughter of Kim So Hyun, who was a Tsunuka (first-ranked officer), and she was also a younger sister of Kim Yu-shin.

sen.j: 王妃は新羅官位制度（4等官）の善品の娘の慈儀王后。
sen.e: Queen Ja-eui was a daughter of 善品, who was forth-rank officer of the official rank system in Silla.
Queen Ja-eui was a daughter of Seonpum, who was a Hachinsan (forth-ranked officer).
sen.cmt: 「新羅官位制度」はリンク先の用語で原文は「波珍飡」。また「善品」の英語表記を挿入しました。
sen.e: Queen Ja-eui was a daughter of Seonpum, who was a Hachinsan (forth-ranked officer).

sen.j: 661年6月に先代の武烈王が死去し、王位に就いた。
sen.e: In June 661, when the former ruler, King Muyeol, passed away, he took the throne.
In June 661, he ascended the throne as the former ruler King Muyeol passed away.
In June 661, he ascended the throne as the former ruler King Muyeol passed away.

sen.j: 在位中に高句麗を滅ぼし、また唐の勢力を朝鮮半島から駆逐して、半島の統一を果たした。
sen.e: During the reign, he destroyed the Korean kingdom of Goguryeo, and unified the Korean peninsula by driving the Tang dynasty's power out of the peninsula.
During his reign, he destroyed the Korean kingdom of Goguryeo and unified the Korean peninsula by driving the Tang Dynasty's power out of the peninsula.
sen.cmt: the をhisに、dynastyの頭文字を大文字に、不要なカンマを削除しました。
sen.e: During his reign, he destroyed the Korean kingdom of Goguryeo and unified the Korean peninsula by driving the Tang Dynasty's power out of the peninsula.

sen.j: 武烈王として即位する前の父・金春秋が唐と新羅との緊密な関係を築いて帰国した後、649年の百済との局地戦の戦勝報告と、真徳女王が唐の威光を称えて作った五言太平頌を献上することとを任務として、金法敏は650年6月に唐を訪れた。
sen.e: After his father Kim Chun-chu, who had not ascended the throne as King Muyeol yet, established a close relationship between Tang China and Silla, and returned to the country, Kim Beopmin visited Tang in June 650 for the missions to report the victory of the local war with Baekje in 649 and present a great peace poem of five-word verses written by Queen Jindeok, admiring the prestige of the Tang dynasty.
sen.cmt: 「頌：デジタル大辞泉の用語解説 - 人の徳や功績をたたえる言葉・詩文。」とありますので、「五言太平頌」は、五言漢詩で太平を謳ったものと解釈してあります。
sen.e: After his father Kim Chun-chu, who had not ascended the throne as King Muyeol yet, established a close relationship between Tang China and Silla and returned to the country, Kim Beopmin visited Tang in June 650 in order to report the victory of a local war against Baekje in 649 and present a great peace poem of five-word verses written by Queen Jindeok, admiring the prestige of the Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 不要なカンマの削除、for the missionsを削除してin orderを挿入、war withをwar againstに、冠詞の修正、dynastyの頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: After his father Kim Chun-chu, who had not ascended the throne as King Muyeol yet, established a close relationship between Tang China and Silla and returned to the country, Kim Beopmin visited Tang in June 650 in order to report the victory of a local war against Baekje in 649 and present a great peace poem of five-word verses written by Queen Jindeok, admiring the prestige of the Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 高宗 (唐)はこのことを大変に喜び、金法敏は太府卿の職を授かって帰国した。
sen.e: Emperor Gao Zong (Tang) was so delighted with this that the post of Taifu Qing (the minister of palace supplies) was given to Kim Beopmin before he returned to the country.
Emperor Gao Zong was so delighted with this that the post of Taifu Qing (the minister of palace supplies) was given to Kim Beopmin before he returned to the country.
sen.cmt: 「高宗 (唐)」はリンク先の用語と混ざっており、原文は「高宗 」です。
sen.e: Emperor Gao Zong was so delighted with this that the post of Taifu Qing (the minister of palace supplies) was given to Kim Beopmin before he returned to the country.

sen.j: 帰国して後に父が武烈王として即位すると、654年に新羅官位制度（4等官）の位で兵部令（長官）となり、次いで太子に立てられた。
sen.e: When his father ascended the throne as King Muyeol after his return, he became a director under the official rank system in Silla (forth-rank officer) in 654, and then he was appointed to the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 「兵部令」が分かりませんので長官で訳してあります。
sen.e: When his father ascended the throne as King Muyeol after his return, he was given a director position called Hachinsan (forth-ranked officer) in 654, and then he was appointed Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 「新羅官位制度」はリンク先の用語で、原文は「波珍飡」です。
sen.e: When his father ascended the throne as King Muyeol after his return, he was given a director position called Hachinsan (forth-ranked officer) in 654, and then he was appointed Crown Prince.

sen.j: 660年7月の対百済戦役では、金庾信らとともに5万の兵を率いて左武衛大将軍蘇定方の指揮する唐軍に合流して戦って大功をあげた。
sen.e: Leading 50,000 solders with Kim Yushin and other fellows, he fought with Tang's army led by Su Dingfang, 左武衛 Great General in the war against Baekje in July 660, and made great achievements.

Leading 50,000 soldiers with Kim Yushin and other fellows, he fought against Baekje together with Tang's army led by Su Dingfang, who was the Great General of the Left Guard, in July 660, and made great achievements.
sen.cmt: soldierのつづりが間違っているので訂正、against Baekjeの位置を変更、左武衛をthe Left Guardとして挿入しました。
sen.e: Leading 50,000 soldiers with Kim Yushin and other fellows, he fought against Baekje together with Tang's army led by Su Dingfang, who was the Great General of the Left Guard, in July 660, and made great achievements.

sen.j: その後も百済の残存勢力は各地で反乱したが、10月には金法敏らの諸軍が尓礼城（忠清南道扶余郡の青馬山城）を陥落させて、残りの20余城の百済軍もすべて降伏し、百済旧地はいったん平定された。
sen.e: Although the remaining forces of Baekje continued to rebel in every part of the country, Kim Beopmin and allied forces got 尓礼城 Castle (青馬山城 Castle in Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province) fallen, and all the remaining forces of Baekje in more than 20 castles surrendered, which resulted in subjugating the old territory of Baekje once.
sen.cmt: 城名は調べましたが確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Although remaining forces of Baekje continued to rebel in various regions, Kim Beopmin and allied forces got 尓礼城 Castle (青馬山城 Castle in Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province) fallen, and all the remaining forces of Baekje in more than 20 castles surrendered, which made old territories of Baekje suppressed once.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、which以下を書き換えました。
sen.e: Although remaining forces of Baekje continued to rebel in various regions, Kim Beopmin and allied forces got 尓礼城 Castle (青馬山城 Castle in Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province) fallen, and all the remaining forces of Baekje in more than 20 castles surrendered, which made old territories of Baekje suppressed once.

sen.j: 百済を平定した唐がその余勢をかって高句麗に進軍し始めた頃、661年6月に武烈王が死去し金法敏は即位した。
sen.e: When Tang China began to advance toward Goguryeo by using the remaining force after the subjugation of Baekje, King Muyeol passed away in June 661 and Kim Beopmin assumed the throne.
When the momentum of their success in the subjugation of Baekje made Tang China begin to advance toward Goguryeo, King Muyeol passed away in June 661 and Kim Beopmin ascended the throne.
sen.cmt: 「余勢をかって」とはその勢いで、という意味であり、残った兵力をもってという意味ではありません。
sen.e: When the momentum of their success in the subjugation of Baekje made Tang China begin to advance toward Goguryeo, King Muyeol passed away in June 661 and Kim Beopmin ascended the throne.

sen.j: 唐からは直ちに高句麗討伐軍に呼応することを求められ、文武王は金庾信らに命じて唐軍のいる平壌へ食糧を補給し、全面的に支援をする構えを保った。
sen.e: Requesting from Tang to support the force to conquer Goguryeo immediately, King Munmu ordered Kim Yushin and other fellows to supply food to the Tang army staying in Pyongyang, showing the intention of total backup.

Requested from Tang to support their army to conquer Goguryeo immediately, King Munmu ordered Kim Yushin and other fellows to supply food to the Tang army staying in Pyongyang, in order to show their intention of total backup.
sen.cmt: RequestingをRequestedに、the forceをtheir armyに、showingをin order to showにしました。
sen.e: Requested from Tang to support their army to conquer Goguryeo immediately, King Munmu ordered Kim Yushin and other fellows to supply food to the Tang army staying in Pyongyang, in order to show their intention of total backup.

sen.j: このときの高句麗は唐の攻撃に耐え、唐軍は食糧を受け取ると戦いを収めて帰国していった。
sen.e: At this battle, Goguryeo held out against the enemy attacks, and the Tang army ended the battle and returned to China after receiving the food.
At this battle, Goguryeo held out against the enemy's attack, and the Tang army ended the battle and returned to China after receiving the food.
sen.cmt: the enemy attacksをthe enemy's attackにしました。
sen.e: At this battle, Goguryeo held out against the enemy's attack, and the Tang army ended the battle and returned to China after receiving the food.

sen.j: この間662年には唐から＜開府儀同三司・上柱国・楽浪郡王・新羅王＞に冊封された。
sen.e: In 662, Tang conferred honorific titles of "Kaifu Yitong Sansi (Supreme Minister), 上柱国, King of Rakuro County, and King of Silla" on him.
sen.cmt: 上柱国のみ不明ですが、他のものは肩書が付いていますが、これは国名のみです。
sen.e: In 662, Tang conferred honorific titles of "Kaifu Yitong Sansi (Supreme Minister), Jochukoku (an official rank given in recognition of one's services), King of Rakuro County, and King of Silla" on him.
sen.cmt: 上柱国は「じょうちゅうこく」と読み、唐の勲官（ 品階のみで実職を伴わない、勲功に対する官位）のひとつです。
sen.e: In 662, Tang conferred honorific titles of "Kaifu Yitong Sansi (Supreme Minister), Jochukoku (an official rank given in recognition of one's services), King of Rakuro County, and King of Silla" on him.

sen.j: 663年5月からは百済の旧将の鬼室福信らが王族の扶余豊璋を迎えて百済復興の大規模な反乱を起こし、百済・倭国の連合と唐・新羅の連合との間に白村江の戦いが行なわれたが、この戦いにおいて倭国の水軍を壊滅させ、百済の再興の望みを断ち切ることになった。
sen.e: In May 663, former generals of Baekje including Gwisil Boksin raised a large-scale rebellion for revival of Baekje joining hands with Buyeo Pung of the royal family, which resulted in causing the Battle of Hakusukinoe between the allied forces of Baekje and Japan and the allied forces of Tang and Silla, where the Japanese navy was completely defeated and the hope of restoring Baekje disappeared.

In May 663, former generals of Baekje including Gwisil Boksin raised a large-scaled rebellion for revival of Baekje joining hands with Buyeo Pung of the royal family, which resulted in causing the Battle of Hakusukinoe between the allied forces of Baekje and Japan and the allied forces of Tang and Silla, where the Japanese navy was completely defeated and the hope of restoring Baekje disappeared.

In May 663, former generals of Baekje including Gwisil Boksin raised a large-scaled rebellion for revival of Baekje joining hands with Buyeo Pung of the royal family, which resulted in causing the Battle of Hakusukinoe between the allied forces of Baekje and Japan and the allied forces of Tang and Silla, where the Japanese navy was completely defeated and the hope of restoring Baekje disappeared.

sen.j: 666年4月には唐に対して高句麗討伐の出兵を求め、唐は李勣を遼東道行軍大摠管に任命して高句麗への攻撃が開始された。
sen.e: In April 666, Tang was requested to dispatch its troops for conquest of Goguryeo, and attacks to Goguryeo were started after Tang appointed Li Ji to the officer of 大摠管 for advancing the troops to Liaodong Province.
sen.cmt: 遼東道（中国にありますがこの場合正しいかどうか分かりません）行軍大摠管(官位)は、意味が不明のため、漢字の意味から類推しました。
sen.e: In April 666, Tang was requested to dispatch their troops for conquest of Goguryeo, and attacks to Goguryeo were started after Tang appointed Li Ji to the supreme commander of the army to advance to Liaodong Province.
sen.cmt: 大摠管はその軍の最高司令官のことです。
sen.e: In April 666, Tang was requested to dispatch their troops for conquest of Goguryeo, and attacks to Goguryeo were started after Tang appointed Li Ji to the supreme commander of the army to advance to Liaodong Province.

sen.j: 668年になって新羅も唐軍に合流して平壌の長安城を攻め、同年9月21日に高句麗を滅ぼすことに成功した。
sen.e: In 668, Silla attacked Chang'ancheng in Pyongyang together with Tang's troops, and they succeeded in defeating Goruyeo on September 21, 668.
In 668, Silla attacked Chang'ancheng in Pyongyang together with Tang's troops, and they succeeded in destroying Goruyeo on September 21, 668.
In 668, Silla attacked Chang'ancheng in Pyongyang together with Tang's troops, and they succeeded in destroying Goruyeo on September 21, 668.

sen.j: これらの戦いを通じて戦功の著しかった金庾信を遇するために、それまでの最高官位である新羅官位制度の上に新羅官位制度の位を設けて与え、すべての貴族に官位一等の昇進を賜った。
sen.e: To reward the distinguished war services made by Kim Yushin through these battles, a new rank was set over the supreme rank of the official rank system of Silla in order to grant the first official rank to all nobles as promotion.
sen.cmt: 「最高官位である新羅官位制度の上に新羅官位制度の位を設けて与え」日本語が分かりにくいのですが、内容から、最高位の官位の上に新たに位を設けたという意味に解釈してあります。
sen.e: A new rank called Grand-Great Tsunuka was established over Great Tsunuka, which had been the supreme rank in the official rank system of Silla until then, in order to reward distinguished war services made by Kim Yushin throughout these battles, and additionally, every noble was granted a one official rank promotion.
sen.cmt: 「新羅官位制度の上に新羅官位制度の位を設けて与え」はリンク先の用語が混ざっています。原文は「大角干の上に太大角干の位を設けて与え」です。
sen.e: A new rank called Grand-Great Tsunuka was established over Great Tsunuka, which had been the supreme rank in the official rank system of Silla until then, in order to reward distinguished war services made by Kim Yushin throughout these battles, and additionally, every noble was granted a one official rank promotion.

sen.j: しかし個々の恩賞は新羅の軍事力の中核であった中央貴族の私兵層へは与えられず、活躍した地方豪族や百済・高句麗から投降した官・将を積極的に取り立て、王の直接の支配の及ぶ軍事力の育成に努めたのは、武烈王の論功行賞に倣ったものであり、新羅の王権の拡大に寄与することとなった。
sen.e: However, individual reward grants were not given to private armies of the nobles living in the capital, who worked as the core of the military force of Silla, but powerful local clans who worked very hard, as well as commanders and generals who surrendered from Baekje and Goguryeo, were treated favorably in order to foster the military forces under the direct control of the king like the reward-oriented policy taken by King Muyeol, all of which contributed to expansion of the sovereignty of Silla.
sen.cmt: 官・将は、軍隊ですので、司令官と将軍としました。
sen.e: However, individual reward grants were not given to private soldiers of nobles in the capital although they worked as the core of the military forces of Silla, but powerful local clans who had distinguished services, as well as commanders and generals who surrendered from Baekje and Goguryeo, were treated favorably in order to foster the military forces under the direct control of the king, following the reward-oriented policy taken by King Muyeol, and this contributed to expansion of the sovereignty of Silla.
sen.cmt: armiesをsoldiersに、関係代名詞を削除、「who worked very hard」を「who had distinguished services」に、likeをfollowingに、「all of which contributed」を「and this contributed」にしました。
sen.e: However, individual reward grants were not given to private soldiers of nobles in the capital although they worked as the core of the military forces of Silla, but powerful local clans who had distinguished services, as well as commanders and generals who surrendered from Baekje and Goguryeo, were treated favorably in order to foster the military forces under the direct control of the king, following the reward-oriented policy taken by King Muyeol, and this contributed to expansion of the sovereignty of Silla.

sen.j: 百済・高句麗を滅ぼした後に直ちに半島統一ができたわけではなく、先立って663年4月には新羅もまた鶏林大都督府とされ文武王自身も＜鶏林州大都督＞に任じられていたように、唐は百済の故地には熊津都督府などを、高句麗の故地には安東都護府などを設置し、それぞれの遺臣を用いて統治させるという羈縻政策を用いようとした。
sen.e: The peninsula was not unified soon after defeating Baekje and Goguryeo, and as shown in the prior case that in April 663 Silla was declared Gyerim Great Command Area, where King Munmu served as "governor-general of Gyerim Prefecture," Tang established Ungjin and other command areas in the places connected with Baekje, as well as Andong and other military arms in the places associated with Goguryeo, in order to have their surviving retainers govern by using the control system for different ethnic groups.
sen.cmt: 都督府がcommand areaとなっていましたので、大都督府はｇreat command areaとしました。都護府は、軍事機関とありましましたので、その意味で訳しました。正しいかどうか分かりません。
sen.e: The peninsula was not unified soon after Baekje and Goguryeo were destroyed, and as shown in the prior case of April 663 in which Silla was declared Gyerim Great Command Area, where King Munmu served as "governor-general of Gyerim Prefecture," Tang established Ungjin and other command areas in places formerly owned by Baekje, as well as Andong and other military forces in places formerly owned by Goguryeo, in order to have their surviving retainers govern by using the control system for different ethnic groups.
sen.cmt: 「after defeating Baekje and Goguryeo」を「after Baekje and Goguryeo were destroyed」に、「 prior case that in April 663」を「prior case of April 663」としてさらにその後にin whichを挿入しました。
sen.e: The peninsula was not unified soon after Baekje and Goguryeo were destroyed, and as shown in the prior case of April 663 in which Silla was declared Gyerim Great Command Area, where King Munmu served as "governor-general of Gyerim Prefecture," Tang established Ungjin and other command areas in places formerly owned by Baekje, as well as Andong and other military forces in places formerly owned by Goguryeo, in order to have their surviving retainers govern by using the control system for different ethnic groups.

sen.j: こうした唐の姿勢に対抗しようとして、高句麗の宝蔵王の庶子である安勝が残存勢力とともに新羅に亡命してきたのを利用し、金馬渚（全羅北道益山市）に住まわせて670年8月に高句麗王として封じた。
sen.e: To oppose such a posture taken by Tang, Silla used Anseung, an illegitimate child of King Bojang of Goguryeo, who escaped to Silla with the remaining forces, by allowing him to live in 金馬渚 (Iksan City, North Jeolla Province) to achieve a dominance relationship with him regarded as King of Goguryeo in August 670.
sen.cmt: 金馬渚はつづりが分かりませんでした。
sen.e: To oppose such a posture of Tang, Silla used Anseung, an illegitimate child of King Bojang of Goguryeo, who escaped to Silla with their remaining forces, by allowing him to live in Kinbasho (Iksan City, North Jeolla Province) to achieve a dominance relationship with him regarded as King of Goguryeo in August 670.
sen.cmt: 「posture taken by Tang」を「 posture of Tang」に、「金馬渚」は「きんばしょ」（韓国語風読みだとキムマジョ）と読むようなので、ローマ字表記にしました。
sen.e: To oppose such a posture of Tang, Silla used Anseung, an illegitimate child of King Bojang of Goguryeo, who escaped to Silla with their remaining forces, by allowing him to live in Kinbasho (Iksan City, North Jeolla Province) to achieve a dominance relationship with him regarded as King of Goguryeo in August 670.

sen.j: 新羅の送使が随行する形でこの高句麗をして倭国へ朝貢させ、さらに674年9月には安勝を報徳国として再封し、旧高句麗に対する新羅の宗主権を誇示した。
sen.e: Silla had this Goguryeo pay tribute to Japan by being accompanied with Silla's envoy, and in September 674, Anseung was used again to install a puppet regime in 報徳国 in order to demonstrate the suzerainty of Silla over former Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: 「報徳国：名目的に高句麗遺民を冊封した傀儡政権。報徳の語義について『三国史記』新羅本紀の分注では、帰順を意味するものか、あるいは地名なのか、不明であるとしている。」傀儡政権としました。英語表記は不明です。
sen.e: Silla had this Goguryeo pay tribute to Japan by being accompanied with Silla's envoy, and in September 674, Anseung was given a title of King of Bodeok to establish a puppet regime there in order to demonstrate the suzerainty of Silla over former Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: 原文に「報徳国」とあるのはリンク先の用語で原文は「報徳王」。英訳を挿入しました。また該当箇所周辺の記述を書き換えました。
sen.e: Silla had this Goguryeo pay tribute to Japan by being accompanied with Silla's envoy, and in September 674, Anseung was given a title of King of Bodeok to establish a puppet regime there in order to demonstrate the suzerainty of Silla over former Goguryeo.

sen.j: 安勝を高句麗王に封じたことで唐からは叱責されたが、新羅は却って旧百済領域の支配をめぐって唐との対抗姿勢を明確にし、671年には泗沘の占領と所夫里州の設置を初めとして、次々に旧百済領域を奪取していった。
sen.e: Although Tang rebuked Silla for regarding Anseung as King of Goguryeo, Silla clearly showed its posture opposing to Tang over domination of the former Baekje territory, and in 671 Silla wrested the former Baekje areas one after another starting with occupation of Sabi and establishment of 所夫里州 Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 英語表記不明です。州は、中国の古代行政区分ではprefectureですので、それを使用しました。
sen.e: Although Tang rebuked Silla for having Anseung as the King of Goguryeo, Silla clearly showed its posture opposing to Tang over the domination of the former Baekje territory, and in 671, Silla wrested the former Baekje areas one after another starting with occupation of Sabi and establishment of 所夫里州 Prefecture.
sen.cmt: regradingをhavingに、カンマの追加しました。
sen.e: Although Tang rebuked Silla for having Anseung as the King of Goguryeo, Silla clearly showed its posture opposing to Tang over the domination of the former Baekje territory, and in 671, Silla wrested the former Baekje areas one after another starting with occupation of Sabi and establishment of 所夫里州 Prefecture.

sen.j: このために674年1月には唐の高宗からは官爵を削られ、宿衛として留まっていた王弟の金仁問を新羅王に代えようとするとともに、劉仁軌らが新羅討伐に出兵することとなった。
sen.e: As a result, in January 674, Emperor Gao Zong of Tang deprived King Munmu of his official ranks, and arbitrarily declared King Munmu's brother Kim Inmun staying as a night duty guard to be King of Silla, deciding to advance to Silla with punitive forces headed by Liu Rengui and other generals.

As a result, in January 674, Emperor Gao Zong of Tang deprived King Munmu of his official ranks, and arbitrarily declared King Munmu's brother Kim Inmun staying as a night duty guard to be King of Silla, deciding to advance to Silla with punitive forces headed by Liu Rengui and other generals.

As a result, in January 674, Emperor Gao Zong of Tang deprived King Munmu of his official ranks, and arbitrarily declared King Munmu's brother Kim Inmun staying as a night duty guard to be King of Silla, deciding to advance to Silla with punitive forces headed by Liu Rengui and other generals.

sen.j: 文武王は675年2月に謝罪使を派遣して一時的和平を現出したが、その後も小規模な戦闘を繰り返し、676年11月には白江河口部の伎伐浦（忠清北道舒川郡長項）で唐軍に大打撃を与え、ついに唐の新羅征討と半島支配とをあきらめさせた。
sen.e: Although King Munmu dispatched a messenger of apology in February 675 to temporarily create peace, he continued small-scale battles, and caused such heavy damage to Tang's army in 伎伐浦 (長項, Seocheon County, North Chungcheong Province) at the mouth of 白江河 River in November 676 that Tang finally gave up punitive invasion into Silla and conquest of the peninsula.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞のつづりが不明です。
sen.e: Although King Munmu dispatched a messenger of apology in February 675 to temporarily create peace, he continued small-scaled battles and gave heavy damages to Tang's army in 伎伐浦 (長項, Seocheon County, North Chungcheong Province) at the mouth of 白江河 River in November 676, and as a result, Tang finally gave up punitive invasion into Silla and conquest of the peninsula.
sen.cmt: small-scaleをsmall-scaledに、「 caused such heavy damage」を「gave heavy damages」に、「 in November 676 that Tang finally gave up 」を「 in November 676, and as a result, Tang finally gave up」にしました。
sen.e: Although King Munmu dispatched a messenger of apology in February 675 to temporarily create peace, he continued small-scaled battles and gave heavy damages to Tang's army in 伎伐浦 (長項, Seocheon County, North Chungcheong Province) at the mouth of 白江河 River in November 676, and as a result, Tang finally gave up punitive invasion into Silla and conquest of the peninsula.

sen.j: 唐は熊津都督府・安東都護府を遼東地方に引き上げ、朝鮮半島から唐の勢力は排除されることとなった。
sen.e: Tang relocated Ungjin Command Area and Andong Military Arm in the Liaodong district, which resulted in elimination of Tang's power from the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 熊津都督府・安東都護府は、上記、同様。
sen.e: Tang relocated Ungjin Command Area and Andong Military Arm in the Liaodong district, and Tang's influence was eliminated from the Korean Peninsula after all.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: Tang relocated Ungjin Command Area and Andong Military Arm in the Liaodong district, and Tang's influence was eliminated from the Korean Peninsula after all.

sen.j: 古くからの新羅の勢力だけでは唐への対抗が難しいことに気付いた文武王は、百済・高句麗両国の遺民を取り込んで新羅の身分制度を再編することにも努めた。
sen.e: Knowing that it was difficult to oppose Tang only with old forces in Silla, King Munmu also put effort into reorganization of Silla's class system by taking in people left in Baekje and Goguryeo.

Realizing that it was difficult to oppose Tang only with old forces in Silla, King Munmu also put effort into reorganization of Silla's class system by taking in people who were originally from Baekje and Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: KnowingをRealisingに、「 people left in」を「 people who were originally from 」にしました。
sen.e: Realizing that it was difficult to oppose Tang only with old forces in Silla, King Munmu also put effort into reorganization of Silla's class system by taking in people who were originally from Baekje and Goguryeo.

sen.j: 旧来の新羅の身分制度は首都金城（慶州市）を中心とする新羅官位制度と、地方豪族を序列化する新羅官位制度との二本立てであったが、674年には外位を廃止して京位に一本化した。
sen.e: The traditional class system in Silla was composed of the official rank system focusing on the capital Geumseong (Gyeongju City) and that for a hierarchy of powerful local clans, but in 674 the hierarchy system for local clans was abolished for unification with the capital system.

The traditional class system in Silla was composed of the capital rank system mainly used in the capital Geumseong (Gyeongju City) and the local rank system used for a hierarchy of powerful local clans, but in 674 the hierarchy system for local clans was abolished for unification with the capital system.
sen.cmt: 原文は「旧来の新羅の身分制度は首都金城（慶州市）を中心とする京位と、地方豪族を序列化する外位との二本立てであったが」
sen.e: The traditional class system in Silla was composed of the capital rank system mainly used in the capital Geumseong (Gyeongju City) and the local rank system used for a hierarchy of powerful local clans, but in 674 the hierarchy system for local clans was abolished for unification with the capital system.

sen.j: その前年（673年）には百済から帰属してきたものを新羅の官制に取り込んだが、百済での官制の序列に従って新羅官制の序列に組み入れ、両者の連続性を継承させようとした。
sen.e: In 673, those who transferred from Baekje were integrated into the official rank system of Silla by properly giving ranks according to their ranking in the official rank system of Baekje in order to maintain the consistency between the two systems.

In 673, those who transferred from Baekje were integrated into the official rank system of Silla by properly giving ranks according to their ranking in the official rank system of Baekje in order to maintain the consistency between the two systems.

In 673, those who transferred from Baekje were integrated into the official rank system of Silla by properly giving ranks according to their ranking in the official rank system of Baekje in order to maintain the consistency between the two systems.

sen.j: また、高句麗移民に対しては安勝を保護して高句麗王、次いで報徳王として新羅の配下に冊封していたが、680年には文武王の妹を安勝に降嫁させて新羅・高句麗の王家の結合を図り、旧の三国が一体となるように努めた。
sen.e: For people from Goguryeo, Anseung was under control of Silla by protecting him as King of Goguryeo and then King of 報徳, but King Munmu put much effort into integration of the former three kingdoms by having his younger sister marry Anseung in 680 to unite the two royal families of Silla and Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: 報徳のつづりが不明です。,
sen.e: For people from Goguryeo, Anseung was under control of Silla by protecting him as King of Goguryeo and then King of Bodeok, but King Munmu put much effort into integration of the former three kingdoms by having his younger sister marry Anseung in 680 to unite the two royal families of Silla and Goguryeo.
sen.cmt: 報徳の英語表記を挿入しました。
sen.e: For people from Goguryeo, Anseung was under control of Silla by protecting him as King of Goguryeo and then King of Bodeok, but King Munmu put much effort into integration of the former three kingdoms by having his younger sister marry Anseung in 680 to unite the two royal families of Silla and Goguryeo.

tit.cmt: 前置詞の修正しました。

sen.j: 中央官庁の整理について、667年には立法を司る理法府を増設し、左右理法府とした。
sen.e: To reorganize the central government offices, he added the ministries of order to deal with legislation: the right and left ministries of order.
sen.cmt: 「理法府」は調べても分かりませんでした、意味を取って訳しました。
sen.e: To reorganize the central government offices, he added the ministries of order to deal with legislation, and they respectively called these offices the right and left ministries of order.
sen.cmt: コロンを削除して書き換えました。
sen.e: To reorganize the central government offices, he added the ministries of order to deal with legislation, and they respectively called these offices the right and left ministries of order.

sen.j: 678年には左右理法府にそれぞれ1名の卿（次官）を増員配置し、また同年に兵部の管轄下にあった船舶管理を船府として独立させ、令（長官）を配置した。
sen.e: In 678, he additionally assigned a vice minister to each of the right and left ministries of order, and in the same year he established the Ministry of Vessels by separating vessel management operations from the control by the Ministry of Military with the minister assigned.
sen.cmt: 卿は不明のため、次官で訳しました。船府は、意味を取って訳しました。令は不明のため、長官で訳してあります。
sen.e: In 678, he additionally assigned another vice minister to both the right and left ministries of order, and in the same year, he established the Ministry of Vessels by separating vessel management operations from the control by the Ministry of Military with the minister assigned.
sen.cmt: aをanotherに、each ofをbothに、カンマの追加しました。
sen.e: In 678, he additionally assigned another vice minister to both the right and left ministries of order, and in the same year, he established the Ministry of Vessels by separating vessel management operations from the control by the Ministry of Military with the minister assigned.

sen.j: 百済・高句麗の故地を直接統治していくことについて、百済の旧都泗沘に所夫里州（州治は現在の忠清南道扶余郡）を置いたように、百済の南西部には発羅州（州治は現在の全羅南道羅州市）を置いた。
sen.e: To directly govern the places associated with Baekje and Goguryeo, 発羅州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was Naju City, South Cholla Province now) was established in the southwestern part of Baekje like 所夫里州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province now) in the old capital Sabi, Baekje.
sen.cmt: 旧州名のつづりが不明です。
sen.e: In order to directly govern places formerly owned by Baekje or Goguryeo, 発羅州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was present-day Naju City, South Cholla Province) was established in the southwestern part of Baekje in the same way that he had established 所夫里州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province now) in the old capital Sabi, Baekje.
sen.cmt: ToをIn order toに、「故地」をplaces formerly owned byに、「like」を「in the same way that he had established」にしました。
sen.e: In order to directly govern places formerly owned by Baekje or Goguryeo, 発羅州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was present-day Naju City, South Cholla Province) was established in the southwestern part of Baekje in the same way that he had established 所夫里州 Prefecture (prefectural capital was Fuyu County, South Chungcheong Province now) in the old capital Sabi, Baekje.

sen.j: また、678年には高句麗の平原城跡に北原小京（江原道原州市）を、680年には加耶郡に金官小京（慶尚南道金海市）を置いて地方統治の拠点とし、あわせて王都金城の文化の普及に努めた。
sen.e: In addition, he established the secondary capital of 北原 (Wonju City, Gangwon Province) at the site of 平原城 Castle in Goguryeo in 678, and the secondary capital of 金官 (Gimhae City, South Gyeongsang Province) in Gaya County in 680 as the bases to govern local areas while trying to disseminate the culture of the imperial capital Geumseong.
sen.cmt: 古い地名と城名が不明です。
sen.e: In addition, he established a secondary capital of 北原 (Wonju City, Gangwon Province) at the site of 平原城 Castle in Goguryeo in 678, and another secondary capital of 金官 (Gimhae City, South Gyeongsang Province) in Gaya County in 680 as a base to govern local areas while trying to disseminate the culture of the imperial capital Geumseong.
sen.cmt: 「the secondary capital」をそれぞれ「a secondary capital」「another secondary capital」に、「the bases」を「a base」にしました。
sen.e: In addition, he established a secondary capital of 北原 (Wonju City, Gangwon Province) at the site of 平原城 Castle in Goguryeo in 678, and another secondary capital of 金官 (Gimhae City, South Gyeongsang Province) in Gaya County in 680 as a base to govern local areas while trying to disseminate the culture of the imperial capital Geumseong.

sen.j: 6世紀に既に設置されていた州・小京とともに、新羅の地方統治の九州五小京の完成まであとわずかとなった。
sen.e: With the prefectures and secondary capitals already established in the 6th century, it was not long before the system to govern the local areas of Silla under the nine prefectures and the five secondary capitals would be completed.

With prefectures and secondary capitals already established by the sixth century, it was not long before the system to govern the local areas of Silla under the nine prefectures and the five secondary capitals would be completed.
sen.cmt: 「in」を「by」に、6thをスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: With prefectures and secondary capitals already established by the sixth century, it was not long before the system to govern the local areas of Silla under the nine prefectures and the five secondary capitals would be completed.

sen.j: 文武王の時代には王都金城の作りが改められてもいる。
sen.e: In the reign of King Munmu, the imperial capital Geumseong was reconstructed.
In the reign of King Munmu, the imperial capital Geumseong was reconstructed.

sen.j: 674年2月に宮城である半月城付近に月池（後に雁鴨池と呼ばれる）を造営し、また679年には王宮の修築を行ない、この地に東宮（臨海殿）を建てた。
sen.e: In February 674, he constructed 月池 Pond (later called Anapji Pond) near the imperial castle, Banwolseong Castle, while in 679 he repaired the royal place, and built the crown prince's palace (臨海殿 Palace) there.

In February 674, he constructed 月池 Pond (later called Anapji Pond) near the imperial castle called Banwolseong Castle, and in 679, he repaired the royal palace and built the crown prince's palace (臨海殿 Palace) there.
sen.cmt: カンマを削除して「called」を挿入、「while」を「and」に、「place」を「palace」にしました。
sen.e: In February 674, he constructed 月池 Pond (later called Anapji Pond) near the imperial castle called Banwolseong Castle, and in 679, he repaired the royal palace and built the crown prince's palace (臨海殿 Palace) there.

sen.j: 王城内には四天王寺 (新羅)（慶州市仁旺洞狼山）を建立させたほか、王城を離れた周辺地域への寺院建立も進め、676年には高僧の義湘に浮石寺（慶尚北道栄州市浮石面）を創建させている。
sen.e: He got 四天王寺 Temple (Silla) (仁旺洞狼山, Gyeongju City) built and promoted construction of other temples in the surrounding area far from the king's palace while in 676 he allowed a high priest Uisang to found Pusoksa Temple (Pusoksa 面, Yeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province).

He got 四天王寺 Temple (仁旺洞狼山, Gyeongju City) built and promoted construction of other temples in the surrounding area away from the king's palace, and in 676, he allowed a high priest named Uisang to found Pusoksa Temple (Pusoksa 面, Yeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province).
sen.cmt: far fromをaway fromに、whileを削除してカンマとandを挿入、a high priestのあとにnamedを挿入しました。
sen.e: He got 四天王寺 Temple (仁旺洞狼山, Gyeongju City) built and promoted construction of other temples in the surrounding area away from the king's palace, and in 676, he allowed a high priest named Uisang to found Pusoksa Temple (Pusoksa 面, Yeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province).

sen.j: 在位21年にして681年7月1日に死去し、文武王と諡された。
sen.e: After 21 years of the reign, he passed away on July 1, 681, and the posthumous title of King Munmu was given.
After 21 years of his reign, he passed away on July 1, 681, and the posthumous title of King Munmu was given.

sen.j: 王自身のかねてからの遺詔によって、新羅では初めて火葬された王となり、骨壷は東海（日本海）の浜辺の大石の上に葬られた。
sen.e: According to his previously expressed will, he became the first cremated king in Silla, and his cinerary urn was placed on a big stone on the beach of the East Sea (Japan Sea).
According to his previously expressed will, he became the first cremated king in Silla, and his cinerary urn was placed on a big stone on the beach of the East Sea (Japan Sea).
According to his previously expressed will, he became the first cremated king in Silla, and his cinerary urn was placed on a big stone on the beach of the East Sea (Japan Sea).

sen.j: 俗伝では王は護国の大龍に化身したといい、この大石を大王岩といった。
sen.e: According to a tradition of the world, the king transformed into a giant dragon protecting the country, and this stone was called the great king rock.
According to a popular tradition, the king transformed into a giant dragon guarding the country, and this stone was called the great king rock.
sen.cmt: 「a tradition of the world」を「a popular tradition」に、protectingをguardingにしました。
sen.e: According to a popular tradition, the king transformed into a giant dragon guarding the country, and this stone was called the great king rock.

sen.j: また、王のためにその地には感恩寺（慶尚北道慶州市陽北面）が建てられた。
sen.e: In addition, 感恩寺 Temple (陽北面, Gyeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province) was built for the king at the site.
In addition, 感恩寺 Temple (陽北面, Gyeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province) was built for the king at the site.
In addition, 感恩寺 Temple (陽北面, Gyeongju City, North Gyeongsang Province) was built for the king at the site.

sen.j: 感恩寺に伝わる書物には、文武王が倭兵を鎮圧するためにこの寺を建てようとしたが完成する前に亡くなっており、同寺は神文王の2年（682年）に完成したという。
sen.e: The book handed down to 感恩寺 Temple says that King Munmu started building this temple to break down Japanese soldiers, but died before its completion in 682.
A book handed down to 感恩寺 Temple says that King Munmu started building this temple to break down Japanese soldiers, but he died before its completion in 682.

sen.j: 神文王の7年（687年）に新羅の祖廟の祭祀として、神文王にとっては父の文武王、祖父武烈王、曽祖父文興葛文王（金龍春）、高祖父真平王、及び太祖大王（金氏王統の始祖である13代味鄒尼師今）の五廟の制度が整備された。
sen.e: In 682 under the reign of King Sinmun, for the religious service for the mausoleums in Silla, the five-mausoleum system was established in order to enshrine the souls of the five kings of his father King Munmu, grandfather King Muyeol, great-grandfather Galmunwang 文興 (Kim 龍春), great-great-grandfather King Jinpyeong, and progenitor Great King (the earliest ancestor of the royal line of the Kim clan, the 13th Michu Isageum).
sen.cmt: 「デジタル大辞泉の用語解説 祖廟- 祖先の霊をまつる御霊屋」とありますので、亡骸というより、霊の方が良いと思います。（文武王以前は土葬なので、それ以前に亡くなった人の遺体を掘り返すことはしていないと思われます） 文興葛文王（金龍春）は、不明です。世代をさかのぼると女王が２代続いています。葛文王は、タイトルとありますので、女王の夫に与えられたものかもしれません。
sen.e: In 682 under the reign of King Sinmun, the five-mausoleum system for religious services for ancestral mausoleums in Silla was established in order to enshrine the souls of the five kings of his father King Munmu, grandfather King Muyeol, great-grandfather Galmunwang 文興 (Kim 龍春), great-great-grandfather King Jinpyeong, and progenitor Great King (the earliest ancestor of the royal line of the Kim clan, the 13th Michu Isageum).
sen.cmt: 祖廟=ancestral mausoleums、「for religious services for …」の位置を変更、冠詞の修正しました。
sen.e: In 682 under the reign of King Sinmun, the five-mausoleum system for religious services for ancestral mausoleums in Silla was established in order to enshrine the souls of the five kings of his father King Munmu, grandfather King Muyeol, great-grandfather Galmunwang 文興 (Kim 龍春), great-great-grandfather King Jinpyeong, and progenitor Great King (the earliest ancestor of the royal line of the Kim clan, the 13th Michu Isageum).

sen.j: 第36代の恵恭王の時代には、五廟の対象を恵恭王の父景徳王・祖父聖徳王、文武王、武烈王、味鄒尼師今としており、文武王は武烈王・味鄒尼師今とともに代々不変の宗として特別な位置づけとされた。
sen.e: In the reign of the 36th ruler, King Hyegong, the five-mausoleum system was applied to his father King Gyeongdeok, grandfather King Seongdok, King Munmu, King Muyeol and Michu Isageum, and King Munmu was specially regarded as the key ancestors not changed for generations together with King Muyeol and Michu Isageum.

sen.cmt: 「the key ancestors 」を「a key ancestor」に、そのあとをwhose…でつなげました。
